2.25.23  3:26 am   how do you get the courage to experiment when you know it won't be as polished as just sticking to what you already know?

      nothing is polished. i don't know how to polish things

      that's your opinion, not mine

2.24.23  11:45 pm   how do you make cold wind go away? it kinda just shows up sometimes and ruins the morning

      the wind makes the wind go away. it blows itself away. there it went

2.24.23  11:31 pm   Is it possible to write without constantly being trapped in an "editor mindset"?

      sure. that sounds like a handy trick, actually

2.24.23  9:40 pm   Is there a name for when you substitute a min7 chord for a dom7 chord? Like, if you're in C major and you do an D7, E7, or A7 (instead of Dm7, Em7, Am7)?

     indeed, i call that 'normal'

     It doesn't feel like a "modal interchange" or anything fancy like that because the melody will still feel very much like plain old C major. And sometimes too you'll even have a C7 (particularly before going to the F), but it doesn't feel like you're in C mixolydian or anything like that. <

     that one you just mentioned reminds me of a door handle that turns sideways when the door opens. even though the handle is normally not in that position, the sideways position IS actually a normal position for the purpose of opening the door. not only normal, but powerful. a real door opener, that C7 (to F)

     I can think of a lot of songs (especially common in old timey songs) that have a chord pattern like:

C C7 F F#dim C A7 D7 G7 C A7 D7 G7 C

But it still feels and sounds like C major even though most of those chords aren't in the key. Would you still consider that to be in C major?

     yep

     Maybe the key of a song is totally based on the melody and not the harmony?  

     even with no melody, the chord sequence you are describing is certainly in the key of C. .....It's as if we're trying to figure out whether a donut with sprinkles is still a donut, even though the sprinkles are not made of donut. indeed it is still a donut, especially considering the decorative materials in question are in fact very standard classic materials, used in the very standard classic way. and no one in history has ever dared to call such a donut a non-donut

2.24.23  8:27 pm   do ya have a favorite paradox?

      the non-paradox

2.24.23  5:52 pm   I've written a song and I really like it, but there's not really a good intro and I can't think of one. does that ever happen to you

     sure

     (and if so, how do you find a good intro) or are you just built different

     i have no idea how to do it. sometimes it's good to check what happens right before it returns to the first section the second time. sometimes the right intro will be hiding there. on the other hand, sometimes a misdirect is best: use something that makes it sound like you are NOT about to play the song that's about to happen (so that when it does, it's a surprise). I still don't have a reliable technique for finding an intro to a song which seems to have been born without an intro. But maybe the best way is to write a scene for the song to spring from. that method might be the most powerful

2.24.23  3:15 pm   Do you ever get feelings that you just cannot describe with words, only with music/sound?

      much more commonly, there are things that cannot be described with words alone OR music alone. ..... only.... B O T H

2.24.23  1:42 pm   how did 'not steve' climb the mountain so quickly,

      It's urgent.

     no it's not

     Thank you.

2.23.23  5:48 pm   For the middle section of "if the world doesn't end " where ut goes "its good its bad" I understand that it starts on a gmin7 then I think moves to a F#maj7/Ab on "been like that". But on "rearrangement " I can't work out what goes on in that bin but on the "yh" I know it settles on a f#maj7 but I'm wondering how u got there in terms of approaching it harmonically.

     'rearrangement' is Ab7sus4 (or Gb/Ab). "situation" is Dbmaj, then Gbmaj7.

     Also for the " it's wrong its right " am I right in saying it goes from Cmin7add9

     also known as Cmin9

     to some variation on Bbmin7?

     same thing as the prev chord, with the melody dictating whether the 9 is used

      I can hear a really sick synth slide to a C and F on "slipped into this new rhythm " which makes me think it could be a sus 2 or something on the Bb.

   the sliding flute chord you're hearing also contains the Db note. and the chord in general that the rhythm sec does is Bbmin9 (or just Bbmin7 if melody not on 9). the flutes don't play the Ab, just the 2,b3,5 cluster  

     It's by far my favourite middle section of yours though.

2.23.23  5:07 pm   Did you make the car sounds in "Perfect." with your mouth?

      yes

2.22.23  7:23 pm   Favorite planet?

      i've only been to 1, which also happens to be the only one i can breathe on. Unless you include the ones that are insanely far away that i've never heard of and can't get to. But even the ones that are closer, i still can't get to those, and can't breathe on those ones either. so there is really only 1 answer here, and i'll give you a hint it's the one that's in the news a lot, and it's also the one where 99.9999% of every movie you've ever seen was produced. it's also the home of most of your favorite fruit

2.22.23  6:47 pm   what were the origins of "where I've been"?

      during an idea generating session on apr 11, 2019, i came up with the chord figure and melody for the verse. during a songwork session on apr 20, 2021, i got the lyrics to the first stanza. in late august 2022, i was searching through the list to find the next song to select for song/video production (due sept 13), and "where i've been" seemed to be a highly favored choice at that time, but i instead decided to actually use no selection, and just start writing a video (to possibly lead into a song, or maybe not) without any song selection. But i guess "where i've been" was still at the forefront of my mind, so i ended up launching into it within the first few seconds of the dialogue. It was actually my goal to really write something that combined song and non-song in a more 50/50 balanced way, but then there's also generally a desire to make the song playable as a song on its own, outside the video. As i continued writing, i actually broke out of the song and back into more dialogue after the first stanza. And that was pretty fun and cool, but i knew that wouldn't work for the song-only version. So then i found myself in a position where i was writing 2 different versions of this whole thing, in parallel: one version which breaks in and out of song, and another version that stays in the song once the song starts. And pretty quickly i realized that that would be way too confusing. So i just kept it in song without breaking it. So my goal of really mixing the song and non-song 50/50 turned out to be a failure, this time around. and the "where i've been" song ended up taking over, with no return to diaglogue, for the rest of the video. Also, the goodbyes section has a completely alternately written version, which still ends with the last line as is (where i was / wasn't). I ended up completely rewriting that section because the first version felt like it had too strong a similarity to the 'bring me down / pick me up' section of ground plane

      i think, because 'good' has no ceiling, and is also very elusive, you should try to make something bad on purpose, just to loosen up a little

2.21.23  12:13 pm   how do i lower my impossibly high standards for things?

2.21.23  11:51 am   For "is that you on the stage?" I figured that for the "is that you on the" bit it's Ebmaj7 but for "stage" it's a bit hard to work out coz my ear was expecting ,upon my first listening of I like to wear soft clothing , to hear an fmajadd6 of some sort, but if seems to be a Gmaj7 instead, maybe a sus2 coz I can't hear a third really.

     something like Gmaj9 or something. and yes, knowing me i probably skimped on the 3rd in favor of the 2, in that situation

      I guess it's kinda like 9 8 7 (my favourite) where it took me forever to work out that the main verse is Dmin then Cmaj7sus2sus4 which is essentially G/C right?

     hold your horses. no sus4 there. i'm sure you just made a typo. anyway, the chord there is something like Cmaj9, and, again, knowing me i probably skimped on the 3rd for most of them. indeed making it more like Csus2maj7, which is indeed the same as G/C

      I feel like there might be a similar kinda thing going on in I like to wear soft clothing but idk

     that individual chord may be the same, but those 2 sections do not seem similar to me

2.21.23  11:28 am   What's the thought process behind most of the lyrics?

      it's intertwined with the music, and the goal with the lyric-music combination is to get something as potent as possible
